definition: to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)
to prepare herbal medicine by roasting or parching (in a pan)
to sauté/to fry/to dry by heating

sentences.english: Howitzer and Rocket Accuracy has been slightly decreased by 5 points.
sentences.chinese: 榴弹炮和火箭精度已略有下降5个百分点。

sentences.english: An additional exterior gunner controls the projectile cannon.
sentences.chinese: 榴弹炮由一名额外的舱外炮手控制。

sentences.english: Next time, the PLA will use a lot more than just howitzers.
sentences.chinese: PLA下一次会使用多得多的榴弹炮。

sentences.english: The nuke round now fires with the trajectory of a standard howitzer shot.
sentences.chinese: 核弹轮现在火灾与一个标准的榴弹炮射击轨迹。

sentences.english: About 35 minutes later, the South fired three howitzer shells into the sea.
sentences.chinese: 大约35分钟过后，韩国的榴弹炮向海中打了三炮。

sentences.english: There is no longer a "skip point" on either howitzer's gun.
sentences.chinese: 在重新不再是一个“跳过点”或榴弹炮的枪。

sentences.english: Engineers can now properly construct howitzers during the single player campaign.
sentences.chinese: 工程师现在可以正确地建造在单人战役榴弹炮。

definition: Bofors, Swedish arms company involved in major corruption case during 1980s
